main event: On September 6, 1950, in Malden, Missouri, a bright object changed colors as it approached, stopped, hovered, and then went out of sight within 1 minute. The report indicated that the characteristics of the object were not consistent with those of an astronomical body as viewed through the inversion.
interesting points: The bright object changed colors as it approached and hovered before disappearing, exhibiting non-astronomical characteristics.
The sighting lasted approximately 1 minute, and it was observed by numerous people.
The object's movement and colors observed did not align with characteristics of astronomical bodies as viewed through inversion.
The report indicates that the object's direction of travel, color changes, and apparent size were not consistent with an astronomical body.
The report suggests a possible temperature inversion causing the observed phenomena.
sighted object: one bright object that changed colors and hovered
